fields.summary: If issue's due date unspecified, inherit the due date of the fix version
Make message handlers more defensive wrt the size of incoming messages
Jira issue shows "Last commented" information even though it has never been commented
Change admin title for Troubleshooting and Support
how to set  fix version empty when resolve issue?
UI doesn't inform me why I cannot edit a user directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27108].
  {panel}

If I have:
# A public JIRA site with
# A project that uses a permission scheme with the *Browse Projects* project permission set to *Anyone* and
# I create an issue filter which is shared with *Everyone*

That means that anonymous people have access to this 'shared filter'.

However, if I share that 'shared filter' with:
# A JIRA user --- that user receives an email message containing a link to the filter.
# Any email address (not registered with a JIRA user) --- the recipient receives an email message containing a link to the search results, not the issue filter.

I believe in case no. 2, for consistency, the email address recipient should receive a link to the issue filter.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in behaviour when sharing anonymously accessible shared filters.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27107].
  {panel}

In January I was automatically provided access to SuccessFactors JIRA system and I'm not sure what initiated the process so I apologize if I'm submitting a request an incorrect way.  I am a consultant with a certified implementation partner of SF; HRIZONS.  We have a new consultant that just finished his CORE certification with SF and will begin working with customers very soon.  He will need access to JIRA to look up potential issues and to submit issues.  Below is he contact information:

Name:  Colin Houghton
E-mail:  colin.houghton@hrizons.com

If more information is needed please do not hesitate to contact me...tonya.kuklinski@hrizons.com.
fields.summary: Need access to JIRA for another consultant at HRIZONS

fields.description:
Hi All,

every time I want to install JIRA standalone 4.3.4 an error occured: 

"Could not activate indexing: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.NullPointerException"

I have to install urgently because of test reasons so I would like to ask you for help and suggestions.
fields.summary: Error in JIRA setup
JIRA that integrates with LDAP users via Crowd should allow users to be added to groups maintained in JIRA's internal directory too!

fields.summary: NoClassDefFoundError exceptions recorded in logs
Error Message (The selected filter The selected filter {0} has an error: {1}. has an error) in Filter Gadget should be More Explanatory
linking an issue after cloning it should be an option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27097].
  {panel}

Create custom field of type multi checkbox.
Create a screen with two tabs.
In one of the tab, add *only* the custom field of multi checkbox type.

=> when viewing issue, tabs are not displayed in view screen, other fields are displayed one below the other.
=> tabs are displayed in other screen (eg : Edit issue using the same screen)

Add another  field with multicheckbox in the second tab
=> tabs are displayed in view screen and edit issue, but multicheckbox not displayed in second tab (only other type)

See attachment
fields.summary: MultiCheckbox field not displayed in tab for ViewIssue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27095].
  {panel}

1) Set up a cloud connector link to Zendesk.
2) From a JIRA issue, create a remote link to a Zendesk ticket.

The Zendesk ticket appears as a remote link on the View Issue page, showing the ticket's summary.

!Zendesk.png!

3) In Zendesk, change the ticket summary to something else.

!NewTest.png!

In JIRA, the value doesn't update. Even after a page refresh.

!Zendesk.png!
fields.summary: Cloud Connector remote link text doesn't update when a Zendesk ticket subject changes
Customware Connector links open in a new tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27093].
  {panel}

i need a chart or table displaying  issues group by the  "group" field on dashboard

but i can't find any gadget on dashboard that can display issues group by the "group" field.

they only can group by fields like "components","priority","Resolution". ,but no "group"!

 

so is there a gadget has the feature can group by "group".?
fields.summary: i need a chart or table display issues group by the  "group" field on dashboard
Update Fix Version Post Function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27088].
  {panel}

Form dialogs created in initDialogs.js do not trigger when clicked inside Tempo screens.

Chrome JS console does not report that initDialogs.js is present but JIRA.Dialogs.comment is defined.

If we manually insert the code from initDialogs.js, then the triggers work as expected. 

The workaround is to hide the links with CSS but many customers are requesting to be able to perform the actions/operations inside of Tempo. But we would rather not copy paste the code from initDialogs.js to get things working. Besides, the resource is defined in jira-global so it should be present on Tempo screens.
fields.summary: Inline form dialogs do not work in a plugin
Stop Watching all Closed Issues
want JIRA Importers Plugin settings page back  in JIRA version 4.4.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27078].
  {panel}

Please copy form view on the NY Sec Master JIRA to augment the existing fields in SRDR JIRA form view..

Also, please include these two addition drop downs in SRDR form views..

Error Categories

This is to categorise the error that we are reporting. i.e. the error/defect was caused because of the following reasons

Requirement Error 
Data / Config 
Env / Infra 
Program Code 
Interface / 3rd Party 
Change Request 
Design Error 
Build /System Data Error 
Test Data Error 
Test Case Error 
Parameter Error 
Training / Process Error 
Not Classified Yet 
 

Downtime Reason

This is to categorise the downtime that we are reporting. i.e. the downtime was caused because of the following reasons

Repository Not Available 
Network failure 
Database Server Down 
Main Server down 
Hardware problem 
Desktop problem 
Waiting for Incident Fix 
Batch run delay 
Dev Env Not Available 
QA Env Not Available
fields.summary: This request is to update SRDR JIRA to reflect more details when an activity is requested/logged
"Workload Pie Chart"-Report is not part of JIRA 4.x as documented in "JIRA Charting Plugin"
'Go back to top' button in the operation bar
Add FixVersion to Activity Stream
Allow JQL history search for the Issue Type field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27065].
  {panel}

SVN commit activity are showed Jira dashboard using the FishEye Recent Changesets gadget.

A Linker was configured in FishEye to be able to mention changesets in SVN commit messages when one changeset/commit references another.

The linker is set up and it is working in FishEye but not in the FishEye Recent Changesets Gadget on JIRA.

Customer would like the link to be rendered as well in the FishEye recent changes gadget.
fields.summary: Linker in Fisheye doesnt show up in activity stream in Jira Fisheye gadget
Set Default Comment Group Per Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27063].
  {panel}

See https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JIM-594
I want to close this issue on StAC as it blocks my JIM 4.0 release.
Also we agreed to track tech-writer tasks here on JAC.

I guess that you are at the moment working on it anyway.
fields.summary: Update CSV documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27061].
  {panel}

The email received use the "From" field in the form to fill the "Reply to" in the email. 

It's very confusing, since the "From" field in the email shows the Administrator email because it came from the instance, so it takes the "Outgoing Mail" configuration and use the email setted there.

It should be show the sender somewhere besides the "Reply to" field. Maybe put the email from the person who needs help in the body of the email would be a better approach.

A workaround to see who sent the email would be look for the Headers and see the "Reply To" field or click on "Reply" in the mail client to check it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27055].
  {panel}

Editing an active workflow shows the message (in blue) "This workflow is Active. You will only be able to make changes to the layout."

I had to browse through several Jira issues to end up at JRA-7661, where I then learned that this message is simply not true. Apparently, you can edit them, you just have to jump through stupid hoops for no reason: click 'create draft' at the top and then publish it. (Note also that you can't _not_ publish it!)

So, I see several issues:
- at the very very least, the message should say that you can make draft/publish
- if it's possible via the the make draft/publish, it's possible and I shouldn't be forced to go through that. Let me edit, if you want to 'make draft' and 'publish' behind the scenes, do whatever you need
- for working on a big change, the draft can be useful, but then at least I should be able to drop (aka cancel/clear/revert or whatever you want to call it) the draft!
- from the docs I see the editing a draft of an active workflow still has some limitations, so maybe these should get a message in blue too.
fields.summary: Editing active workflow is non-obvious
Issue type and project drop-downs don't show currently selected item in the list

It would be great if we could provide our customer an estimation of their JIRA instance database depends on a number factors such as

* Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27028].
  {panel}

When performing an upgrade to the current version of the Cloud Connectors, it forgets that the admin has already accepted the licence. This breaks various functionality in the plugin for end-users until an admin logs in and accepts it again.

--------------

Setup:

1) Set up an OnDemand instance with the current Studio production version (studio-fireball-128.1).
2) Go to any Connector admin screen and accept the EULA.
3) Configure a connection to Zendesk.
4) Link a JIRA issue to a Zendesk ticket.
5) Upgrade the instance to the latest OnDemand version (studio-fireball-snapshot-nightly-r129127 in my test).

--------------

Post-Setup:

* Go to any Connector admin screen. It shows the licensing screen again:
!EULA.png!

* End-user scenario:
** Log in as a non-admin user.
** Return to the JIRA issue created before the upgrade.
** Go to the "Manage Application Links" screen (an end-user-visible screen accessible from the dot dialog or More Actions dropdown).
** Click "Pull" or "Push" to resync the issue with Zendesk.
** It fails because of the licensing issue:
!ErrorForbidden.png!

** If you're an admin, it also fails but accidentally embeds the admin screen in the page because the error message is not HTML-encoded (a possible XSS vulnerability).
!BadEULA.png!
fields.summary: On upgrade, Cloud Connectors forget that the licence has been accepted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27026].
  {panel}

The XML view does not shows the Full Name. Steps to replicate:
# create a User Picker field and add it to a screen
# create a new user. Let's say username="jalbion" Full Name="Janet Albion"
# create an issue and set choose "jalbion" in the User Picker type field
# go to Issue Navigator
# add User Picker type custom field to the column
# search for the issue in the Issue Navigator
# choose to view the Issue in the XML view and the XML will return username:
{noformat}
<customfields>
<customfield id="customfield_10100" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:userpicker">
<customfieldname>userpicker</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues><customfieldvalue>jalbion</customfieldvalue></customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
</customfields>
{noformat}
fields.summary: XML View Display User As Username Instead of Full Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27019].
  {panel}

MS SQL must be set 'READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT=ON' or there will be an error:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Upgrade+to+4.4+on+MS-SQL+times+out

It is not stated in the 'Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2008' documentation:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008

By default, it is not set to be ON. Please update the documentation to include the step to set it.
fields.summary: Update the 'JIRA 4.4 Upgrade Notes' (and possibly 'Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2008') documentation with important information regarding JIRA installations connected to SQL Server databases.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26984].
  {panel}

Hi there!

A client reported an issue with the UPM Plugin in JIRA 2.7.10 and I was able to reproduce it.

This is the issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-7881

{noformat}
com.atlassian.extras.decoder.api.LicenseDecoderNotFoundException: Could not find any valid decoders in [com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v2.Version2LicenseDecoder@f3dcf0, com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v1.Version1LicenseDecoder@2e2dc6] for license string
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enter in Fisheye's Administration page.
2. Click on Plugins.
3. Click on Upload Plugin.
4. Choose the file (atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-2.0.jar).
5. Click on Upload.
6. Restart Fisheye.

The error start to be showed in the Plugins Page.

I attached a screenshot of it.

Thank you in advance.

Douglas Fabretti
Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Exception when upgrading to UPM 2.0 in Fisheye

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26963].
  {panel}

We are using com.atlassian.jira.service.services.imap.ImapService to create issues/comments from emails.

We are always using Outlook 2010 and each of our users has an image in the signature which includes the company logo. 

When our end users send us a issue via email this image is always uploaded into JIRA as attachment. 

My request for a new feature would be to filter images based upon naming,size,type (or any other pattern you can find) out of the emails. Otherwise each new comment/issue will have plenty of signature images attached.
fields.summary: Filter image when creating issue/comment from email

2) Link to it from an OnDemand issue.
3) Alert popups appear in both the View Issue page and anywhere the Activity Stream is shown.

We can't reproduce this on our own test instances because we can't get the connector working at all, but it was observed on Customware's test instance:
   https://adzar.jira-dev.com/browse/UTEST-1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26942].
  {panel}

I just wanted to checkup on our database documentation for JIRA.  As you know, JIRA 4.4+ has the database setup within the Setup Wizard.  This is already noted here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database
bq. If you are setting up a completely new JIRA installation, the JIRA Setup Wizard will configure a database connection for you to either JIRA's internal HSQL database or an external database.

The problem is if a customer only checks their specific database sections:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2005
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+HSQLDB
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL

The titles are called 'Connecting JIRA to ____', but in none of these documentations tell a reader that the connection can be setup via JIRA's initial Setup Wizard.

How does a customer get directly to the 'Connecting to ____' pages?
Google is one example.  If you simply type in "jira mysql" into Google, the first few results go directly to 'Connecting JIRA to MySQL'.

I just wanted to bring this to your attention and see if this is something that we should change.
fields.summary: Database documentation does not indicate connections can be setup via the Setup Wizard
Ability to create conditional field requirements during create issue or during issue transition
N/A
JIRA 5 should capture AO database modification errors, provide this information in the UI and disable the plugin that is causing the error
